title: Little Mouse
author: Little Mouse
content: Quoting the reply below, from Coins.game ANN thread-Quote from: LUCKMCFLY on September 20, 2023, 06:51:42 PMThis has been posted by the user mistakenly possibly. I can't imagine how he ended up doing that lol. Both the quotes are from the topic. I tried to relate the reply with Coins.game ANN thread but I couldn't. After that, I reported the post but it wasn't deleted. Then I reported it again yesterday but it's not deleted. Can someone help me learn why it's not a delete-worthy post?You were supposed to post in a thread, but mistakenly ended up posting in another thread but mods don't consider this as delete-worthy?

comments.author: LUCKMCFLY
comments.body: Oh wow, I really didn't realize, what a shame, I'm really sorry, well, but anyone makes a mistake, right? It's just that I posted from my phone and I got confused, but thanks for the warning, although a PM would have been better. I already deleted it.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: LUCKMCFLY on September 24, 2023, 02:27:06 PMOh wow, I really didn't realize, what a shame, I'm really sorry, well, but anyone makes a mistake, right? It's just that I posted from my phone and I got confused, but thanks for the warning, although a PM would have been better. I already deleted it.I have written in the post that it was possibly a mistake and the post is not about you that it could be a PM. It's about why mods don't delete this.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: It's very frustrating using phone to reply post over here sometime if you aren't carefully reread what you posted you endup having incomplete words since phone do Autocorrect words and is very hard to control all less that feature is being turned off.However @Little mouse I will say that there are lots of loads for mods to handle maybe after somewhile it will be deleted, I can remembered some post I do report sometimes the mod don't just immediately delete them it takes days thereabouts.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Now that the matter has been amicably settled (the accused has admitted their fault), I believe it's in order to lock this thread. Otherwise, it will encourage spamming. This is a classical reason why we shouldn't make posts while sleepy. It has dare consequences just like DUI.BTW, I don't think the reported post wasn't deleted because it was not delete-worthy but it could be that mods didn't see it on time. The forum lacks mods.

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: Quote from: Mpamaegbu on September 25, 2023, 02:01:03 PMNow that the matter has been amicably settled (the accused has admitted their fault), I believe it's in order to lock this thread. There was no matter between Little Mouse and LUCKMCFLY, so there shouldn't be such thing as settle amicably. Little Mouse had said that he didn't create the topic because of Lucky, that he has been experiencing similar reluctance by moderators when he reports such kinds of posts for deletion. He therefore wants to know why moderators do not hastily delete such posts. I think it is not time to lock the thread, except a moderator answers Op.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on September 24, 2023, 02:23:26 PMQuoting the reply below, from Coins.game ANN thread-Quote from: LUCKMCFLY on September 20, 2023, 06:51:42 PMThis has been posted by the user mistakenly possibly. I can't imagine how he ended up doing that lol. Both the quotes are from the topic. I tried to relate the reply with Coins.game ANN thread but I couldn't. After that, I reported the post but it wasn't deleted. Then I reported it again yesterday but it's not deleted. Can someone help me learn why it's not a delete-worthy post?You were supposed to post in a thread, but mistakenly ended up posting in another thread but mods don't consider this as delete-worthy?Sometimes we may not inserted the proper reason why the post should be deleted on the reported note made to help the moderators see to why such action should be taken, secondly, the content may not be worthy for being deleted than to inform the user himself to move the post to the expected thread, in this regard, the content is right but on a wrong thread, am sure the moderator would have been linient in waiting for the user to realize this and make the correction than deleting his post, Â we makes mistakes and if we are being informed, it's never bad or too late to make amend.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: Zoomic on September 25, 2023, 03:00:52 PMQuote from: Mpamaegbu on September 25, 2023, 02:01:03 PM~snippedThere was no matter between Little Mouse and LUCKMCFLY, so there shouldn't be such thing as settle amicably. Little Mouse had said that he didn't create the topic because of Lucky, that he has been experiencing similar reluctance by moderators when he reports such kinds of posts for deletion.To the best I could offer, I believe I did outline a possible cause for that in my second paragraph. Well, if you're still insisting on mods coming to comment here before you deem it fit for the thread to be locked; let's see how that works out. The few mods we've here are already overworked and may not have the luxury of time patrolling to respond to threads except they're tagged.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: LUCKMCFLY on September 24, 2023, 02:27:06 PMOh wow, I really didn't realize, what a shame, I'm really sorry, well, but anyone makes a mistake, right? It's just that I posted from my phone and I got confused, but thanks for the warning, although a PM would have been better. I already deleted it.Sometimes that happens and the good step is to edit or delete those posts. I really appreciate that you accepted your mistake and deleted the post. By the way, reporting of all posts isn't necessary because sometimes the issues can be solved via a PM. I have recently made a similar mistake in philipma1957 raffle by selecting a wrong spot which was already selected by someone else. Philipma1957 sent me a pm and I admitted that I unconsciously did that. The matter was solved within seconds because of a PM. I really appreciate philipma1957 for sending that PM. I believe that in future we should try to solve such issues by sending PM to the member who has done something mistakenly.
